newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - May 19.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - May 19.

text.p: -- E.W. Scripps Co has agreed to acquire the media assets of Harte-Hanks Communications Inc for $625-$775 million, the Wall Street Journal reported.

-- Oracle Corp has agreed to buy a unit of Internet access company Netscape Communications Corp, according to industry executives. They said Oracle will buy Netscape's Navio Communications unit, which designs software for browsing the web using devices like television and video game sets.
-- Aetna Inc's president, Joseph Sebastianelli, had resigned effective June 1.
-- Mobil Corp and Amoco Corp are discussing a possible merger of their downstream business in the United States and overseas, Britain's Sunday Telegraph reported.
-- Hewlett-Packard Co said it was cutting prices up to 13 percent on certain computers, including Vectra PC and Omnibook Notebook PC lines.
